section.title: Traits
section.para: Traits are reusable components of behavior that your classes can implement, and are an additional Object-Oriented concept alongside classes and interfaces. Replaced @Mixin .
A trait can have properties, unlike Java 8 default methods for interfaces.
A class can implements several traits. To avoid multiple inheritance the last inherited trait wins, unless the class overrides the method or property directly.
Traits support inheritance, e.g., a trait can extend another trait or implement an interface.
